node.title: Two actors leave the soap opera ‘General Hospital’ over its vaccine mandate.
node.alt: Ingo Rademacher, left, and Steve Burton at the 46th annual Daytime Emmy Awards in 2019. Both left “General Hospital” rather than comply with its vaccine mandate.
node.description: Steve Burton and Ingo Rademacher had refused to comply with a Nov. 1 mandate that applied to actors on the long-running daytime drama’s set.
node.content: ["Two actors have left one of America\u2019s most popular soap operas after declining to comply with an on-set vaccination mandate.", "The actors, Steve Burton and Ingo Rademacher, were fixtures of ABC\u2019s \u201cGeneral Hospital,\u201d a long-running daytime drama set in the fictional town of Port Charles, N.Y.", "About one in five American adults has not received a single dose of a coronavirus vaccine. ", "Mr. Burton and Mr. Rademacher were outspoken opponents of a coronavirus vaccine mandate that applied to a part of the set where actors work unmasked, known in the industry as Zone A. The mandate took effect on Nov. 1.", "\u201cUnfortunately, \u2018General Hospital\u2019 has let me go because of the vaccine mandate,\u201d Mr. Burton, who tested positive for the virus in August and filmed his last episode on Oct. 27, said in an Instagram video on Tuesday.", "\u201cI did apply for my medical and religious exemptions and both of those were denied \u2014 which, you know, hurts,\u201d he added. \u201cBut this is also about personal freedom to me. I don\u2019t think anyone should lose their livelihood over this.\u201d", "Mr. Rademacher\u2019s departure from the show was made public earlier this month. He had also refused to comply with the show\u2019s vaccine mandate. \u201cI will stand with you to fight for medical freedom,\u201d he wrote in an Instagram post.", "Mr. Rademacher has also been criticized on social media in recent weeks for making comments that his critics perceived to be transphobic, a suggestion he has forcefully denied.", "Representatives for ABC declined to comment on the record. Publicists for the actors could not be reached for comment late Tuesday.", "Other Hollywood productions have imposed similar on-set mandates, but there is no universal vaccination requirement for people who work in film and television.", "\u201cGeneral Hospital\u201d has been on the air since 1963. Its episodes are filmed weeks before they air.", "Mr. Rademacher played the character Jasper \u201cJax\u201d Jacks on the show for 25 years. In his last episode, which aired on Monday, the character said \u2014 spoiler alert \u2014 that he would be returning to Australia.", "\u201cI\u2019m kind of on the outs with everyone in Port Charles right now,\u201d the character said. Some fans interpreted that as a reference to the actor\u2019s real-life tension with his castmates.", "In the same episode, Mr. Burton\u2019s character, Jason Morgan, was caught up in a tunnel collapse.", "Mr. Burton said in his Instagram video on Tuesday that he hoped the show\u2019s vaccine mandate would be lifted so that he could finish his career playing Jason Morgan.", "\u201cAnd if not,\u201d he added, \u201cI\u2019m going to take this experience, move forward and be forever grateful.\u201d"]
